unnormalised: Okay, here's the Quora post based on your input parameters:
normalised: So, someone asked about the most exciting cricket match ever. Honestly, there are so many, right? But one that sticks out for me is the two thousand and eleven World Cup final. India versus Sri Lanka. The score was something like two hundred and seventy four for six for Sri Lanka after fifty overs, Mahela Jayawardene scored a brilliant one hundred and three not out. Everyone in India was glued to their T-V-s!

unnormalised: So, someone asked about the most exciting cricket match ever. Honestly, there are so many, right? But one that sticks out for me is the 2011 World Cup final. India vs. Sri Lanka. The score was something like 274/6 for Sri Lanka after 50 overs, Mahela Jayawardene scored a brilliant 103*. Everyone in India was glued to their TVs!
normalised: Then India came to bat. Sachin Tendulkar got out early, with a score of just eighteen. The pressure was immense. Gambhir played an amazing innings, scoring ninety seven. Then Dhoni, our captain cool, came in and finished it off with that iconic six! India won by six wickets, the score reading two hundred and seventy seven for four in forty eight point two overs.

unnormalised: Then India came to bat. Sachin Tendulkar got out early, with a score of just 18. The pressure was immense. Gambhir played an amazing innings, scoring 97. Then Dhoni, our captain cool, came in and finished it off with that iconic six! India won by 6 wickets, the score reading 277/4 in 48.2 overs.
normalised: The atmosphere was electric, one point two billion people erupted in joy. It wasn't just a win, it was a dream come true after twenty eight years. M-S Dhoni's score was ninety one not out, and he was rightfully awarded Man of the Match. I still get goosebumps thinking about it. What a game!
